CET: Discusses achievement goal orientation (AGO), and collaborative learning. Both elements are brought back in the discussion section. However, there is no clear connection to the actual visualizations.

SoV: Multiple, simple, disconnected visualizations

Citation: Atapattu, T., Falkner, K., & Tarmazdi, H. (2016). Topic-wise classification of MOOC discussions: A visual analytics approach. In Proceedings of the 9th International conference on Educational Data Mining (EDM), Raleigh, NC, USA.
Description: Dashboard application to visualize discussion forums
CommentsCET: Uses existing literature to make the case for understanding students' discourse in MOOC forums in order to better understand "learners' cognitive processes". Briefly connects the discussion with existing literature (one reference)
HtmlText:
Citation: Atapattu, T., Falkner, K., & Tarmazdi, H. (2016). Topic-wise classification of MOOC discussions: A visual analytics approach. In Proceedings of the 9th International conference on Educational Data Mining (EDM), Raleigh, NC, USA.

Description: Dashboard application to visualize discussion forums

CET: Uses existing literature to make the case for understanding students' discourse in MOOC forums in order to better understand "learners' cognitive processes". Briefly connects the discussion with existing literature (one reference)

SoV: Interactive multilevel visualization

Citation: Schreurs, B., Teplovs, C., Ferguson, R., De Laat, M., & Buckingham Shum, S. (2013, April). Visualizing social learning ties by type and topic: rationale and concept demonstrator. In Proceedings of the Third International Conference on Learning Analytics and Knowledge (pp. 33-37). ACM.
Description: Describes a tool called Network Awareness Tool to visualize informal learning networks
CommentsCET: Describes networked learning as the theory that guides their research. Discusses the output using this theory, but there are not explicit findings to discuss.
CommentsSoV: Simple graph visualization that allows limited interaction, and it only shows one level of the data.
HtmlText:
Citation: Schreurs, B., Teplovs, C., Ferguson, R., De Laat, M., & Buckingham Shum, S. (2013, April). Visualizing social learning ties by type and topic: rationale and concept demonstrator. In Proceedings of the Third International Conference on Learning Analytics and Knowledge (pp. 33-37). ACM.

Description: Describes a tool called Network Awareness Tool to visualize informal learning networks

CET: Describes networked learning as the theory that guides their research. Discusses the output using this theory, but there are not explicit findings to discuss.

SoV: Simple graph visualization that allows limited interaction, and it only shows one level of the data.



Citation: Shum, S. B., & Crick, R. D. (2012, April). Learning dispositions and transferable competencies: pedagogy, modelling and learning analytics. In Proceedings of the 2nd International Conference on Learning Analytics and Knowledge (pp. 92-101). ACM.

Description: Propose a learninig analytics tool that integrates engagement and pedagogy for visualization of Effective Lifelong Leanring Inventory

CET: Defines meta-competences, engagement, disengagement, learning power, to inform data collection, but not the visualization itself. Brings back the literature in the discussion section

SoV: Multiple, simple, disconnected visualizations



Citation: Kump, B., Seifert, C., Beham, G., Lindstaedt, S. N., & Ley, T. (2012, April). Seeing what the system thinks you know: visualizing evidence in an open learner model. In Proceedings of the 2nd International Conference on Learning Analytics and Knowledge (pp. 153-157). ACM.

Description: Presents a tool that integrates the learner model and information visualization for the identification of knowledge indicating events (KIE)

CET: Introduces the concept of knowledge indicating events (KIE) as "naturally ocurring user actions that are interpreted as evidences for a user's knowledge state, and informs the design on the structure of the open learner model and the KIE. No discussion of findings under existing literature

SoV: Simple interactive visualization is presented



Citation: Hillaire, G., Rappolt-Schlichtmann, G., & Ducharme, K. (2016). Prototyping Visual Learning Analytics Guided by an Educational Theory Informed Goal. Journal of Learning Analytics, 3(3), 115-142.

Description: The paper proposes a methodology to develop visual learning analytics, and demonstrated it using a case study. The scores used for this paper correspond to the case study that explored the visualization of students' emotions.

CET: Discusses the role of emotions in learning connecting with existing literature, and informs the visualization tool using this background. Does not discuss the findings under these theories

SoV: Simple interactive visualization is presented

Citation: de Laat, M., & Schreurs, B. (2013). Visualizing informal professional development networks: Building a case for learning analytics in the workplace. American Behavioral Scientist, 57(10), 1421-1438.
Description: This study presents a learning analytics tool to professional development networks
CommentsCET: The paper makes a relevant connection with networked learning to make the case for the tool, and to briefly interpret the networks that are visualized.
CommentsSoV: Their second part of the paper (revised version of the tool)  shows an interactive tool for the visualization of networks. It shows however a single level of the data
HtmlText:
Citation: de Laat, M., & Schreurs, B. (2013). Visualizing informal professional development networks: Building a case for learning analytics in the workplace. American Behavioral Scientist, 57(10), 1421-1438.

Description: This study presents a learning analytics tool to professional development networks

CET: The paper makes a relevant connection with networked learning to make the case for the tool, and to briefly interpret the networks that are visualized.

SoV: Their second part of the paper (revised version of the tool) shows an interactive tool for the visualization of networks. It shows however a single level of the data

Citation: Lockyer, L., Heathcote, E., & Dawson, S. (2013). Informing pedagogical action: Aligning learning analytics with learning design. American Behavioral Scientist, 57(10), 1439-1459.
Description: This paper proposes a connection between learning design and learning analytics.  The paper then demonstrates this connection with the SNAPP visualization tool, a graph-based viz for interactions in discussion forum
CommentsCET:
The paper advocates for a strong connection between learning analytics and learning design "any user interaction behavior must be analyzed in the specific education context such as the learning design 
and course modality. An understanding of the learning design context is imperative for establishing accurate predictive models alongside pedagogical recommendations. "
CommentsSoV: Simple graph visualization that allows limited interaction, and it only shows one level of the data.
HtmlText:
Citation: Lockyer, L., Heathcote, E., & Dawson, S. (2013). Informing pedagogical action: Aligning learning analytics with learning design. American Behavioral Scientist, 57(10), 1439-1459.

Description: This paper proposes a connection between learning design and learning analytics. The paper then demonstrates this connection with the SNAPP visualization tool, a graph-based viz for interactions in discussion forum

CET: The paper advocates for a strong connection between learning analytics and learning design "any user interaction behavior must be analyzed in the specific education context such as the learning design and course modality. An understanding of the learning design context is imperative for establishing accurate predictive models alongside pedagogical recommendations. "

SoV: Simple graph visualization that allows limited interaction, and it only shows one level of the data.

Citation: Xing, W., Wadholm, R., Petakovic, E., & Goggins, S. (2015). Group Learning Assessment: Developing a Theory-Informed Analytics. Educational Technology & Society, 18 (2), 110–128.
Description: Proposes a learning analytics tool to understand students' interactions in group work
CommentsCET: Introduces computer supported collaborative learning, and group cognition to inform the development of the tool. Discusses the findings under the lens of these theories
HtmlText:
Citation: Xing, W., Wadholm, R., Petakovic, E., & Goggins, S. (2015). Group Learning Assessment: Developing a Theory-Informed Analytics. Educational Technology & Society, 18 (2), 110–128.

Description: Proposes a learning analytics tool to understand students' interactions in group work

CET: Introduces computer supported collaborative learning, and group cognition to inform the development of the tool. Discusses the findings under the lens of these theories

SoV: Two-level, simple, interactive visualization

Citation: Nagy, R. P. (2016). Tracking and Visualising Student Effort: Evolution of a Practical Analytics Tool for Staff and Student Engagement. Journal of Learning Analytics, 3(2), 164-192.
Description: Provides a visualization tool of students' effortm for teachers to assess students and to provide formative feedback
CommentsCET: Provides a review of background literature on students' effort and its effect for motivation and learning. The study discusses the findings under the existing literature, and somewhat informs the design by establishing the constructs to assess
HtmlText:
Citation: Nagy, R. P. (2016). Tracking and Visualising Student Effort: Evolution of a Practical Analytics Tool for Staff and Student Engagement. Journal of Learning Analytics, 3(2), 164-192.

Description: Provides a visualization tool of students' effortm for teachers to assess students and to provide formative feedback

CET: Provides a review of background literature on students' effort and its effect for motivation and learning. The study discusses the findings under the existing literature, and somewhat informs the design by establishing the constructs to assess

SoV: Simple static visualizations are provided

Citation: Van Leeuwen, A., Janssen, J., Erkens, G., & Brekelmans, M. (2014). Supporting teachers in guiding collaborating students: Effects of learning analytics in CSCL. Computers & Education, 79, 28-39.
Description: This paper describes a tool for teacher support
CommentsCET: The paper presents a complete review of  computer supported collaborative learning and how learning analytics tools can support teachers and uses this literature to inform the presented work. The findings are briefly discussed under this lens.
CommentsSoV: Two-level static disconnected visualizations are presented
HtmlText:
Citation: Van Leeuwen, A., Janssen, J., Erkens, G., & Brekelmans, M. (2014). Supporting teachers in guiding collaborating students: Effects of learning analytics in CSCL. Computers & Education, 79, 28-39.

Description: This paper describes a tool for teacher support

CET: The paper presents a complete review of computer supported collaborative learning and how learning analytics tools can support teachers and uses this literature to inform the presented work. The findings are briefly discussed under this lens.

SoV: Two-level static disconnected visualizations are presented



Citation: Janssen, J., Erkens, G., Kanselaar, G., & Jaspers, J. (2007). Visualization of participation: Does it contribute to successful computer-supported collaborative learning?. Computers & Education, 49(4), 1037-1065.

Description: This paper describes a visualization tool for students to explore their collaborations.

CET: Makes connection between the visualization of collaboration, motivation, and external fedback. However, only a brienf mention in the discussion is presented.

SoV: The visualization is interactive so that students' can zoom in or out to see the whole class or jus their own group. However, is a single, non-novel visualization

Citation: Agudo-Peregrina, Á. F., Iglesias-Pradas, S., Conde-González, M. Á., & Hernández-García, Á. (2014). Can we predict success from log data in VLEs? Classification of interactions for learning analytics and their relation with performance in VLE-supported F2F and online learning. Computers in human behavior, 31, 542-550.
Description: Compares different interactions in a learning environment with student performance
CommentsCET: Describes possible interactions in a learning environment, and their implications for teaching and learning. Discusses the findings under the light of existing literature

Citation: Kim, M., & Lee, E. (2012). A Multidimensional Analysis Tool for Visualizing Online Interactions. Educational Technology & Society, 15(3), 89-102.

Description: Proposes a visual analysis tool of online interactions

CET: Informs the requirements of the tool using collaborative learning, and discusses the findings using existing literature

Citation: Hernández-García, Á., González-González, I., Jiménez-Zarco, A. I., & Chaparro-Peláez, J. (2015). Applying social learning analytics to message boards in online distance learning: A case study. Computers in Human Behavior, 47, 68-80.

CommentsCET: Makes connection with social network analysis and collaboration, and uses this literature to discuss the findings.

Citation: Hernández-García, Á., González-González, I., Jiménez-Zarco, A. I., & Chaparro-Peláez, J. (2015). Applying social learning analytics to message boards in online distance learning: A case study. Computers in Human Behavior, 47, 68-80.

Citation: Aramo-Immonen, H., Jussila, J., & Huhtamäki, J. (2015). Exploring co-learning behavior of conference participants with visual network analysis of Twitter data. Computers in Human Behavior, 51, 1154-1162.

Description: Understanding co-learning using a visualization tool for twitter data.

CET: Introduces collaborative learning as the educational theory guiding this study, and uses existing literature to make sense out of the visualization

SoV: Simple, two-level, disconnected, interactive visualizations



Citation: Lonn, S., Aguilar, S. J., & Teasley, S. D. (2015). Investigating student motivation in the context of a learning analytics intervention during a summer bridge program. Computers in Human Behavior, 47, 90-97.

Description: Presents a dashboard to visualize students' motivation

CET: Defines intrinsic motivation as the theoretical framework guiding this study. Discusses the findings using existing literature

SoV: Simple multi-level interactive visualizations that are not necessarily connected to each other
